Name: Warrior
Description: An attacker and tank hybrid that can use many types of weapons. Wears heavy armor.

Name: Rune Fencer
Description: An attacker that requires no support to perform at maximum efficiency.

Name: Rogue
Description: A pure attacker. Deals very high damage when circumstances are ideal. Wears medium armor.

Name: Wizard
Comments:
Does not have the highest MND, but almost does.
Note: One of the most JP-heavy classes to master. Their strongest abilities are kinda busted early game, so it should take a lot of work to unlock them.
Description: A fragile mage that casts powerful spells to deal lots of damage. Wears light armor.

Name: Cleric
Description: A healer that has limited offensive options. Wears light armor.

Name: Monk
Comments:
Similar to Final Fantasy "Monk"
Note: Monk should have pretty low-ish Strength. Attacking should be powerful enough, but this opens up opportunity for higher strengthed classes to subjob it for good results.
Description: An attacker and tank hybrid specializing in unarmed combat. Wears medium armor.

Name: Reaper
Comments:
Note: Has very low Vit/Spi since they can wear heavy armor. Otherwise they would be OP. Tanking should depend on stealing Max HP, not mitigation.
Note: Has high MP and Mnd as "dump stats" to go along with extremely high Str. This makes pumping Str be a generally bad trade-off when trying to min/max.
Description: An attacker that is also capable of tanking when circumstances are ideal.

Name: Hunter
Description: An attacker that does not need to worry about AP.

Name: Shaman
Comments:
Note: Purple crystal color matches the environment well.
Being able to equip axes kinda synergizes with having high luck growth.
Having high luck synergizes with the Scholar's variance-based wind magic.

Note: Default skill is an anti-magic debuff. This is supposed to be used against the Yamagawa thunder-using boss.
Description: A mage that is proficient in casting both damage and support magic.

Name: Beatsmith
Description: An attacker that specializes in supporting the whole party.

Name: Aegis
Comments:
Note: Has decent Spi for good MDef and also for subbing white magic.
Note: Has low MP to limit usage of really strong defensive magic. (Try clever sub-classing to make up for it!)
Note: Since Aegis tank spells are balanced by cooldown, they should mitigate 90% instead of 100% so that using Fairy's "No Cooldowns" with them is not OP.
Description: A pure tank that can take damage for party members without managing Threat.

Name: Dervish
Comments:
A magic caster that can use scythes and wear medium armor.
Note: Spells are all AoE (even the weak ones). *Addendum* I changed my mind, the weak ones are single-target now.
Note: Spells have long CT. Combos with Focus Shield passive (defense up while charging magic).
Note: Spells have high MP costs, but Aura Shield (recover MP when taking damage) can keep their MP up so it shouldn't matter.
Note: Spells have higher base damage and lower scaling damage when compared to spells of other classes.

TODO: AP Battery seems SUPER WEAK compared to their innate Aura Shield (recover MP when taking damage). This is a problem.
Description: A self-sustaining mage with powerful spells that deal lots of damage.

Name: Nomad
Comments:
Note: Has no AoE magic spells.
Note: Only has two "levels" of spell for each element (instead of three).
Description: A versatile mage that can deal either physical or magical damage.

Name: Scholar
Comments:
All spells use more MP than they are worth to offsets the job's versatility. But unlike Warlock, he can use books to help out.
Note: Needs good AGI to combo with Fencer.
Description: A versatile mage with a spell for almost any situation. Learns its abilities from enemies.

Name: Warlock
Comments:
Note: Should have good AGI so that it combos well with Fencer.
Note: Cannot equip books. This would offset their weakness of having low MP.
Note: Spells have no CT.
Note: Spells have slightly less MP costs but are slightly weaker than their equivalents from other jobs.

Don't forget to change Description of Doublecast if I change the abilities name!!!
Description: A healer and mage hybrid. Has a small MP pool. Wears heavy or light armor.

Name: Valkyrie
Description: A tank that specializes in supporting the whole party.

Name: Weaver
Comments:
Note: Highest AGI in the game (even higher than Hunter).
Follow-up note: Why? He is a mage. Is that a good idea? (It seems like Fencer > Hunter > Weaver might make more sense?)
Description: A pure support mage with spells that specialize in manipulating turn order.

Name: Chemist
Comments:
Is a primary healer yet cannot innately equip staves.
Should have low Agi to prevent Hunter sub from being too good (w/ cooldown-free Snipe).
Should have low Agi to prevent Ninja sub from being too good (w/ cooldown-free Utsusemi).
Should have low Vit/HP to prevent tanking subs from being too good (w/ cooldown-free tank abilities).
Description: A healer that also specializes in supporting attackers and mages. Has no damaging abilities.

Name: Ninja
Comments:
Agi is their most valuable stat for tanking, but another class has the highest Agi growth. This is on purpose. It might enable some neat sub-jobbing combos.
They have low Str on purpose so that their provoke is weak.
Description: An attacker that also specializes in evasive tanking.

Name: Assassin
Comments: Question: Should they be able to equip daggers innately? (Maybe just axes/bows is OK?)
Description: An attacker that can either support or deal very high damage.

Name: Samurai
Comments:
Note: Samurai is not meant to be the strongest damage dealer; they are meant to be the tankiest damage dealer.
Important: Needs to have low MP so that Fairy's instant MP->AP fill isn't too powerful when used on Samurai.
Description: A pure attacker that uses lots of AP to deal lots of damage in a single turn.

Name: Summoner
Comments:
Note: The only mage class that can equip all 3 mage weapon types.
Summon spells are the least MP-efficient attacks in the game, but they are very strong.
All spells can only be used once per fight.
Idea: A summon (Death) which is 100% instant kill vs one target only.
Description: A very fragile mage with extremely powerful one-time-use spells.

Name: Mimic
Comments: Can change subjobs on the fly. Has the most all-around/balanced stat growth of every job.
Description: An unusual Class with no clear role that can do almost anything when circumstances are ideal.

Name: Beastmaster
Description: An attacker with unique abilities and the potential to deal lots of damage.
